page.title: 14Our Church
page.content: Coddington church is the only church in our area and is near an ancient tumulus. Leaflets in church tell us that it was built after 1833 when the old church of 1093 was demolished because it was unsafe. The rectory is now a private house and the present vicar lives 5 miles away in Farndon. The belfry has one bell which I have rung and the church clock was made in Whitchurch. In the church the East window was given by the Aldersey family who were chief landowners nearby. The Massie vault and coat of arms is to remember the family who lived at Coddington Hall. Last year they found that the church needed Â£7,000 for repairs and we have had sponsored disco's, and donations which have already made this money. Our services are at 11 o'clock every Sunday and about 15 people attend.
